official_title: Phase III Randomized Trial of Proton Beam Therapy (PBT) Versus Intensity Modulated Photon Radiotherapy (IMRT) for the Treatment of Esophageal Cancer
brief_title: Comparing Proton Therapy to Photon Radiation Therapy for Esophageal Cancer
cancer_type_display: A study for patients with stage I-IVA esophageal or gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma or squamous cell carcinoma.

key_inclusion_summary: Histologically proven diagnosis of adenocarcinoma or squamous cell carcinoma of the thoracic esophagus or gastroesophageal junction.
Stage I-IVA, excluding T4b, according to AJCC 8th edition.
Surgical consultation to determine candidacy for resection after chemoradiation.
Adequate organ function (neutrophils, platelets, renal, hepatic).
key_exclusion_summary: Definitive clinical or radiologic evidence of metastatic disease.
Prior thoracic radiotherapy that would result in overlap of radiation therapy fields.
Severe, active co-morbidities such as uncontrolled infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, or recent myocardial infarction.
